sn7.15:1.2: Now at that time a brahmin named Stuck-Up was residing in Sāvatthī.
sn7.15:1.3: He didn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.
sn7.15:1.4: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
sn7.15:1.6: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
sn7.15:1.8: If he speaks to me, I’ll speak to him.
sn7.15:1.9: But if he doesn’t speak, neither will I.”
sn7.15:1.10: Then the brahmin Stuck-Up went up to the Buddha, and stood silently to one side.
sn7.15:1.11: But the Buddha didn’t speak to him.
sn7.15:1.13: “This ascetic Gotama knows nothing!” And he wanted to go back from there right away.
sn7.15:1.14: Then the Buddha, knowing what Stuck-Up was thinking, addressed him in verse:
sn7.15:2.2: if you want what’s good for you, brahmin.
sn7.15:3.2: “The ascetic Gotama knows my mind!” He bowed with his head at the Buddha’s feet, caressing them and covering them with kisses, and pronounced his name:
sn7.15:3.3: “Master Gotama, I am Stuck-Up! I am Stuck-Up!”
sn7.15:3.6: This brahmin Stuck-Up doesn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.
sn7.15:3.7: Yet he shows such utmost devotion to the ascetic Gotama!”
sn7.15:3.8: Then the Buddha said to the brahmin Stuck-Up,
sn7.15:3.9: “Enough, brahmin. Get up, and take your own seat.
sn7.15:3.10: For your mind has confidence in me.”
sn7.15:3.11: Then Stuck-Up took his seat and said to the Buddha:
sn7.15:4.1: “Regarding whom should you not be conceited?
sn7.15:4.4: Who is it good to venerate properly?”
sn7.15:5.4: Regarding these you should not be conceited.
sn7.15:5.5: They are who you should respect.
sn7.15:5.6: They are who you should esteem.
sn7.15:5.7: And they’re who it’s good to venerate properly.
sn7.15:6.1: And when you’ve humbled conceit, <j>and aren’t stuck-up,
sn7.15:6.4: their task complete, free of defilements.”
sn7.15:7.1: When he had spoken, the brahmin Stuck-Up said to the Buddha,
sn7.15:7.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
